summary: This bill, the 'Continuing High-quality Evaluations of Concerning and Known Persons Of Interest through National Training Updates Act' (CHECKPOINT Act), focuses on improving border security by enhancing oversight and training related to U.S. Border Patrol checkpoints. It establishes a Checkpoint Program Management Office (CPMO) within the U.S. Border Patrol to oversee checkpoint operations nationwide. The bill mandates data collection on various aspects of checkpoint activity, including apprehensions, seizures, and technology usage. It requires regular reporting to Congress and a GAO report on the CPMO's effectiveness. The act sunsets after 5 years and authorizes no additional funding.
